meanings.definition: Move rhythmically to music, typically following a set sequence of steps.
meanings.sent1: She loves to dance in her room to her favorite songs.
meanings.sent2: The children dance happily at the school talent show.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to dance around the spilled milk without stepping in it.
meanings.sent4: The flames seemed to dance in the wind, creating a mesmerizing display.
meanings.sent5: His feet seemed to dance effortlessly across the stage, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: A series of movements that match the speed and rhythm of a piece of music.
meanings.sent1: The ballet dancer's graceful dance was a joy to watch.
meanings.sent2: The traditional dance at the wedding was full of energy and excitement.
meanings.sent3: The leaves on the tree performed a beautiful dance in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The cars on the highway moved in a synchronized dance during rush hour.
meanings.sent5: The colorful fish in the aquarium seemed to dance to the music playing nearby.

meanings.definition: A social gathering at which people dance.
meanings.sent1: The dance at the community center was a fun way to meet new people.
meanings.sent2: She wore her favorite dress to the school dance.
meanings.sent3: The birds in the park seemed to have their own little dance party.
meanings.sent4: The city streets came alive with the dance of celebration during the festival.
meanings.sent5: The wedding dance brought everyone together in a joyful celebration.
